result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt F Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kurt F Bauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kurt F Bauer was found guilty of Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total costs to be paid while on probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Not to engage in home improvement projects where defendant would handle the money. Can only work on an hourly basis.
Defendant must submit DNA sample while in custody.
Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kurt F Bauer in court with attorney James Henry Finn.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing at 03-10-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Kurt F Bauer in court with attorney James Henry Finn.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendation and moves to amend count 1. Court breaks for Atty Sisley to get amended information. 9:56 am/Court resumes with same appearances. State files amended information. Court breaks for Atty Finn to complete plea questionnaire. 11:00 am/Court resumes with same appearances. Plea questionnaire filed. Restitution has been paid, however, victim requests to be at sentencing. State recommends on count 1: 2 yrs probation with conditions: not engage in home improvement where defendant handles the money and 60 days condition time. State moves to dismiss counts 2-4. Defendant provided assisted listening device. Court examines defendant, accepts no contest plea and finds defendant guilty. Sentencing adjourned to March 10, 2016 at 9:00 am.
